message.content:
```json
{"solution": {"Original category": "Sale", "Recorded category": "Depreciation", "Original date": null, "Recorded date": "2024-01-07", "Original payment/receipt_status": null, "Recorded payment/receipt_status": "Unpaid", "Original payment_method": null, "Recorded payment_method": null, "Original quantity": "3.0", "Recorded quantity": "3.0", "Original price": "9710.71", "Recorded price": "9710.71", "Original receive_method": "Account Receviable", "Recorded receive_method": "Account Receviable", "Original amount": "29132.13", "Recorded amount": "29132.13", "Original tax": "1456.61", "Recorded tax": "1456.61", "Original profit": "14132.13", "Recorded profit": "14132.13", "Original Preparer": null, "Recorded Preparer": null, "Original Approver": null, "Recorded Approver": null, "id": "Sale20240107030"}}
```
**Reasoning:**
- The invoice text for `Sale20240107030` describes a sale transaction ("an invoice was issued for a Sale") involving 3 units at a unit price, matching all the sale fields (amount, quantity, unit price, tax, cost, profit).
- The "recorded_type" is incorrectly set to "Depreciation", whereas all other fields and the invoice text support that this is actually a Sale.
- All the numeric and structural fields are consistent with the invoice; only the category/type is mis-recorded.
- There are no indications that any other fields (amounts, quantities, accounts) disagree with the reliable description in the invoice.
- Thus, the category should be "Sale" instead of "Depreciation". All other fields are correct per the invoice.
